website_summaries.verdict: A durable shade sail that comes in a range of rectangular sizes from small to massive.
pros: If you really need to cover a giant space, these Patio Paradise shade sails come as large as 24 square feet
Made with 160 GSM polyethylene that is permeable to allow rainfall to pass through and protects from 95% of harmful UV rays
cons: High winds can tear these shade sails, and some customers reported that their sail did not come with hardware

customer_reviews.title: Great sail to cool my house.
customer_reviews.text: My second sail. We use it to block the sun in front of our house, so now that makes 2. I installed the sail with elastic bands at the top (house) to minimize stress to the house and sail. At the bottom end the rope that's included with again elastic band on each rope. Keep them up even on a windy day as the sail doesn't block the wind much. This helped a lot to keep the temperature lower.
customer_reviews.author: eFMer

customer_reviews.title: Nice shades
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these in May 2018 to go over the back patio. They've worked very well to cut the sun and heat back there and have held up pretty well to our weather. That said, one of them came down yesterday after the edge came un-sewn and the nylon edge tape pulled out. Given the 3-year warranty and "satisfaction guarantee", I have reached out to the company to see if they will honor the warranty. UPDATE: Took a few weeks of back-and-forth with the seller, but the replacement shade sail arrived today. It takes a while to hear back from them, so be patient, but they do back up their warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J. Allred

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about 2 years ago and forgot to review it. Well it’s been in the weather and through 2 hurricanes here in Houston. It’s still up with no tears and is probably one of the best products I have purchased on Amazon. It’s sags a little but for what it’s been through I can’t blame it.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn, TX

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy shade sail but a few issues
customer_reviews.text: My shade sail has been up for for about 18 months and has withstood many windy days while providing some much needed shade. It's been quite a trouper. I did and do have a couple issues with it. The first few rainy days left my white french doors very stained from the fabric's color. I was able to get everything cleaned up and then it happened again and then again. The second issue is the D-rings. They are not stainless steel and have rusted significantly. I would have liked a stainless steel option even if it is a couple dollars more.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: Just a pretty tarp.
customer_reviews.text: Not all that impressed with the material. Feels very cheap and that it could easily tear. The sun will definitely dry rot this into shreds within a year or two. However, I am sure they are all made like this so it's nothing against the manufacturer. I really had no choice but to go with one of these. I have high winds here off Lake Michigan and patio umbrellas don't last . One thing helpful I would like to add: FOR THOSE WHO SAY THEY SAG IN THE MIDDLE, YOU ARE INTALLING THEM WRONG. YOU MUST HAVE SAME SIDE CORNERS AT DIFFERENT ELEVATIONS AND OPPOSING CORNER (DIAGONAL) AT SAME ELEVATION. YouTube how to probably install one of these sails.
customer_reviews.author: 97Widerider

customer_reviews.title: The edges were pulled tight but the middle sagged to the point that it was unusable.
customer_reviews.text: Loved the idea. Heres the review on our particular sail: The edges are well-sewn, but the middle droops no matter how tightly the shade sail is pulled using the Patio Paradise hardware kit. My husband and I pulled and pulled and PULLED. The edges were taught but the middle just sagged terribly. To make matter worse, the rubber coated wires that are part of the hardware kit for the sail snapped. So, we got a dud of a sail. Bummer. I've seen them work beautifully, but ours was a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: Moi Bell

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get technical with it, just hang it and let it flow!
customer_reviews.text: It’s PERFECT! You may have to play with it a bit to see how it’s best to hang. We raised and lowered different corners over several days until we got it just right.
customer_reviews.author: FirstLadySoto

customer_reviews.title: Gives great shade
customer_reviews.text: Because of the size of this shade tarp, you need extra hands to set it up. But, the brown looks good here in Texas and the tarp gives good shade over our driveway for our cars from the TX sun!! The car is actually a few degrees cooler than outside with the use of this shade tarp. The water resistance is somewhat relative but does help keep the heavy rains displaced.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Significantly Reduces the Heat Under Our Pergola
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect sunscreen for our pergola. It's incredibly durable, looks great, and significantly reduces the heat from the hot Georgia sun. We didn't secure it in exactly the recommended fashion, so it would have been nice to have a few additional grommets, but that is a minor quibble.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Villines

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: This was more difficult to install than I anticipated, but I am pleased with the final result. I would get it a little tighter if I could figure out how. I used rope ratchets for 2 corners. It provides nice shade will still letting some light through. I prefer this to an umbrella and I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: maddykins

customer_reviews.title: They have been great for our needs
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these as temporary shade for our recently built and rather magnificent porch, while we mull over roof/awning ideas. They have been great for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Vandermeer

customer_reviews.title: 30+ degrees less in the shade!!! Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing! I used 550 and 1000 para cord and tied it to trees and shed about 40-50 feet away, hand tighten as much as you can, held up through 50 Mph gusts and down pours! About to take It down in October and save it for the spring! A game changer!
customer_reviews.author: Cj

customer_reviews.title: Sagging
customer_reviews.text: Smaller sizes may work better but our 16x20 started sagging the day after we installled it and has gotten worse every day. I’d also recommend using 4 turnbuckles rather than just 2.
customer_reviews.author: jodio

customer_reviews.title: Great shade
customer_reviews.text: I am fair skinned, so I needed something to shade under my pergola. This works really good and has held up to the weather very well. I live in the midwest, so I store it in the winter. It has survived some high winds, hail and lots of sun rays all day with no signs of wear.
customer_reviews.author: John de Norde

customer_reviews.title: I got cloth burlap. Seriously like for crafts
customer_reviews.text: Literally got a rectangle piece of fabric burlap. No kidding. Was supposed to get a 12x12 sunshade with hooks so it could be hung up. Seriously, worse amazon purchase yet.
customer_reviews.author: Oscarthegrouch1984

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: We needed a simple shade for our deck that we can put up as needed and take down afterwards and this works perfectly. I attached anchors to two points on the house and two points on the deck railing and we just clip the shade on and take it off as needed (I bought simple eye screws and carabiners-- it works very well). I still feel the need to wear a hat when the sun is directly overhead but that can't be helped unless we were to install an actual roof over the deck which isn't an option.
customer_reviews.author: Primer

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant bargain.
customer_reviews.text: Big shade for super cheap when you get the standard sizes. Good construction, solid webbing on the perimeter and beefy looking d-rings on the corners. My use was not as designed so I never had it under tension, but it makes great shade. To give an idea of 90% blockage looks like... if you look close, without sunglasses, you can see a shadow of a hand... but it's barely there. Wind certainly gets through it to some extent. While hanging in 15kts, it blew in the wind but not much. I'm sure stretched out flat as designed it would not be a wind damage concern under 30-40kts.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Civello

customer_reviews.title: Good quality item for the price 👍
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item over two years ago and we still love it. I was really concerned that something this low priced would only last a season. But it still "hanging" in there. Provides great shade, and looks fantastic. We are probably going to add another to our side yard, and I am definitely going to get this same one.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla B

customer_reviews.title: Great shade for an above ground pool.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. We purchased this to hang above our above ground pool to help keep debris out and to keep the water temperature lower, it has done both. We put 4 - 12 ft. 4x4 treated posts in the ground about 2 ft., poured Sackrete around the post and let it dry, connected the sun shade to it, works perfectly. I would definitely recommend and purchase again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: MV2012

customer_reviews.title: Good value. Work well and look nice.
customer_reviews.text: We’ve now purchased 7 of these now. We live in Tucson and have them on 3 different pergolas for shade. It’s best to overlap a few for ultimate sun protection. They’ve done well in the rain during monsoon season and dry fast. The cords they come with aren’t great. Buy paracord- works much better.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Yasssssss!
customer_reviews.text: Really pleased with this tarp. It lets light through for my shade loving plants and bathtub fish pond and still provides a huge amount of shade. Installation instructions were weird so we watched a few YouTube videos and really liked an Aussie’s idea to use chains instead of rope. We have a tool called a Come-a-long (because my husband is extra like that) which made installation incredibly easy. You’ll need to buy an installation kit in order to properly install this. I bought the 6”. But if you have a Come-a-long all you really need are chains and carabiners.
customer_reviews.author: K. J Ward

customer_reviews.title: This is a great cover, love the green too
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cover, love the green too. We are covering our pool with this and it's the best thing except for having an indoor pool I guess. FYI, we put springs on the four corners to help save it during heavy winds. The springs really do help "soften" the jerking or tearing of the straps during rough weather. I bought 4 of the light to medium duty screendoor type springs with the small chains on the end which was also a plus for adjusting.
customer_reviews.author: Jones

customer_reviews.title: Yay!
customer_reviews.text: I’m so confused how 2 feet make it go from 80$ to 300$?! Anywho... We got the 16x20 and it’s perfect. We have it hooked from the awning (I think that’s it) to the fence which puts it at the perfect angle should we accidentally leave it up when it rains. The rope it comes with is for the birds! We went to Lowe’s and got 4-5” chains (little thicker than what you’d hang a porch swing with. So far so good. It covers almost all of the shallow end.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly & Rene (But mostly Kelly)

customer_reviews.title: great looking cover
customer_reviews.text: I had 2 sheets of fabric in the past. This one fits beautifully. The water resistance was pretty good but water still came through. Sun protection is great and this was easy to install for me.
customer_reviews.author: John Henrich

customer_reviews.title: Makes my deck tolerable in the sun. My little vacation spot!
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly this square adds just the right amount of shade to our blazing hot upper deck. I want to sit outside on my deck more often than ever. It’s kind of makes it cozy. We installed corner poles behind our deck posts and attached string lights and this shade. We also installed different hook heights so we can adjust the angle. Seems to be good quality and has made it through at least 3 bad storms. I am very happy with it. Also no idea why the photos post sideways so sorry about that.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lederer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this if you have much wind...
customer_reviews.text: Hate to say it but this sun shade was torn up by the wind in less than a week. It looked good and comes well equipped but I'm back to where I started but $35 lighter...
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Landski

customer_reviews.title: Nice shade but needed to replace the ropes.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a 10x15 for my application and it served the main purpose, it provides a nice shade while still letting little light come through. The rope that comes with the Shade is a waste, and needed to buy the hardware required. My setting did not allow to have a pole in close proximity so I struggle a little to complete the installation. I liked the color but did not like that much the material as it looks a lot like a refined tarp. All in all, I am ok with the final product and more importantly my wife liked it.
customer_reviews.author: AJBR

customer_reviews.title: Builds mold
customer_reviews.text: Gets moldy. I’ve had it for a little over a year and it has built a very unattractive and unpleasant mold. It does not look good. On the week of April 27, 2020 I spoke to Yanaise, she asked me to send an email with my shipping address, pictures and order details to have it replaced since it was still under warranty. I have since sent three emails and left a message and no response. They are also not answering the phone anymore. I hope they’re doing well but certainly disappointed that the shade that is to be replaced under a warranty is not being followed up on.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Belbusti

customer_reviews.title: Good sun shade
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these for my south facing sliding doors. They really helped to keep the interior a little cooler. The two sliding doors get hot direct sun in the afternoon. I didn't order the hardware as I thought it was little expensive. However, after going to the big box store and buying D rings and turn buckles, I'd buy the hardware kits next time. I took down the shades after used a month, as the weather has turned cooler and the afternoon sun helps warm the interior. I'll reinstall them next summer.
customer_reviews.author: RVer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: This is the first sun shade we had put up and it is really well made. We have 2 others from other sellers, one works the other is trash. We will buy from this seller again. My husband is a builder and put it up with turnbuckles from Lowes - so he knew what he was doing which was really helpful. GREAT quality, we've tightened the sail a few times and its wonderful:) thank you
customer_reviews.author: Lorna Adams

customer_reviews.title: Provides great sun protection
customer_reviews.text: The sun protection that it has added to my patio has been great, expanding the time that we can spend on the deck as it was getting the intense evening sun. The sail is more yellow than beige, which I don't really like. I have found it difficult to get it tight enough that it doesn't flap in the wind but otherwise, the installation was fairly easy. It is not water resistant, as the rain water strains through, which is good as it doesn't hold the heavy water. Overall, I am pleased with its coverage.
customer_reviews.author: D. M. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Works Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I did not expect this product to be so durable. Our installation location was not typical so we had to place it where we could having some sag to the sail. It has whipped around in the wind for several days without issues. Love the product and we are going to purchase another one for a different location.
customer_reviews.author: L. Cisneros

customer_reviews.title: the size is smaller than actually size.
customer_reviews.text: I like the color and material of this Sun Shade. However, I am using it for my pergola with size 12' x 20'. The shorter at longer is okay for me but the width is important. This shade four corners are the size, but actually the shade size is 10'x 13', it is not fit for a pergola. I use it for a good trying. However, next year I will need a good fit size shade.
customer_reviews.author: ShirleyB

customer_reviews.title: Replace rope with cable but it’s awesome
customer_reviews.text: Only complaint is the ropes that were included. I replaced them with some steel cables from a local hardware store. Other than that very strong. It’s been up during several strong storms with high winds. Makes a huge difference in the blazing sun behind my house. Rental agency decided to cut down all the shade trees on the western side of my home. Evening sun baked the house before.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Sistrunk

customer_reviews.title: Well made with good quality fabric and hardware
customer_reviews.text: This sun shade is well made with strong well finished seams. The hardware hooks on each end are secure and can withstand fairly strong wind gusts. I recommend using bungi cord to ease any stress sudden gusts might do to the shade. Mine has lasted through high winds without any wear and tear to the hardwear hooks on each end. The color is a rich hunter green that blends in with the outdoor environment. Its a large 12x16 size but the green color makes it look less noticable. I expect it to last many years. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Peter DP

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great! Make sure to measure 12-18 inches shorter than ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! Make sure to measure 12-18 inches shorter than each of your anchor points so that it stretches properly. I would suggest using a chain with turnbuckle style hooks at each corner to keep it tight. It will have a slight sag if you don't pull it tight and maintain tension in all directions. We are very happy with the shade, especially since we replaced the sagging kid pool with a new spa right after these pictures were taken. Overall, a great value and quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Carver

customer_reviews.title: Be aware of the size - it sags a LOT
customer_reviews.text: The quality is good--but just be aware of the size you're buying. We bought a 16 by 20 foot, but probably should have bought 14 by 18 size. When you hang it, it will sag a LOT. So, a smaller size would have been better. We hang it from the four corners, but use rope from corner to corner to keep it from sagging so much that it doesn't hit our heads when we walk under it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Hartzer

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: As described. Color is a golden tan. Used white ball bungees and galvanized eyelet screws inside wood arbor to tie it up, which keeps tension on the fabric as it naturally stretches out and makes it easier to take down when not using it. Wish they made an 8 x 3 or similar banner width to hang on the end, sunny side of my arbor for that little extra shade.
customer_reviews.author: eartheditor

customer_reviews.title: Great item!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice item, installed it just before 2 storms with high winds hit our area! The material stitching looks very strong and sturdy, material is light in weight, it shades out a good portion of the sun. Water does pass through the material, it is not waterproof, even though I did give a 5 star rating for water resistance.
customer_reviews.author: John & Rachel Landis

customer_reviews.title: Buy at Your Own Risk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in June, but couldn’t put it up, until 08/15/2020. Opened up the package, and found two perfectly sliced areas, like someone used a box cutter on it. I didn’t use anything to open up the package, except my hands, because it was wrapped in 1mil plastic bag. Don’t buy this, buy another brand, something that will get to you intact.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Smith

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt block sun comes right through
customer_reviews.text: Arizona sun gets right through this ,there for this is not providing adequate shade...unhappy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: mitch chapman

customer_reviews.title: It’s very durable and keeps the kennel cool in the summer
customer_reviews.text: We have had this sun shade since June 2017. We use it as an outdoor kennel cover for our dog so she doesn’t get too hot in the summer. It’s very durable and keeps the kennel cool in the summer. We left it up this winter and it has also withstood 6-10 inches of snow on top of it without effecting the integrity of the shade. I’m very impressed. It is not impervious to rain so if it does rain don’t plan on being able to stay dry. But that’s ok. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Zach's Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Not square
customer_reviews.text: While this product does do a good job at reducing the heat level absorbed by the aluminum frame of our garden room. However, the dimensions of the shade are not 10x10 as advertised meaning it is not square and therefore not easy to hang in a neat vertical position. On the one we receive, one of the corners was longer than the others. The construction of the corners, grommet and edges is very good. If one overlooks the irregular shape, price-wise, this product is better that buying bulk sheeting at a DIY store and creating your own sail.
customer_reviews.author: Columbus

customer_reviews.title: Basically a piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews but I feel the need to warn against this. I couldn't resist the price but this shade sail isn't even worth twenty bucks. The first one arrived with multiple small holes in it. I was worried about it ripping further in the wind so I returned and ordered a replacement. The replacement is worse. It has little knots all throughout it. They kind of look like bugs when sitting under it. It catches the eye and is unattractive and cheap looking. I recommend paying more for a quality shade sail and skip this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So necessary for the summer
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. Totally revitalized my outdoor space. Cools off my outdoor area about 20 degrees in the summer! super durable. I've had it for a full year and no rips or tears even though it has been constantly rubbing up against my tree when the wind blows. - Install as tight as possible as this will billow in the wind. Consider removing it during the windy season.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Auxais

customer_reviews.title: Trampoline cover
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use a trampoline cover. To help provide some shade from the sun and a cover from the pine needles. We have had it several months now and it’s still working perfect. We live in the south where we get heat, humidity, a lot of rain and sun. It’s held up perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Maria G

customer_reviews.title: Very nice shade sail
customer_reviews.text: Very nice shade sail. Quality is really nice. It’s higher quality than another brand that I purchased previously. I would purchase this product again. Please note that this style of shade leaves about a 5” gap on each side. If you don’t want the gap, you will need to buy another style.
customer_reviews.author: Radeon888

customer_reviews.title: Eyelets aren’t stainless steel as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this one specifically due to the fact that it was advertised as having stainless steel D rings, and had good reviews. However the rings are obviously not stainless steel and have already started rusting after only 3 weeks! I should have checked with a magnet before installing instead of trusting their advertising. The shade is otherwise well made, it’s a shame they skimped on the 4 eyelets to save a couple of dollars...! Have since purchased a second additional shade on Amazon from a different manufacturer for less money. I checked that one with a magnet before installing and it does use stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Makes a difference in temperature
customer_reviews.text: My husband did a great job hanging this from surrounding trees and buildings. It really makes a difference in temperature and creates shade all day long. Water runs thru it so it does not protect from the elements but if it's just misting out it's good coverage. We love it!
customer_reviews.author: Cw

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Sun Shade That Has Performed Well for My Purposes
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this to prevent things dropping onto my deck from the deck above. It has worked well for this purpose and looks good too. It also provides some protection from the sun and rain. Very high quality construction and very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Robert T. Borremans

customer_reviews.title: Droopy
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a 10x10x10 triangle shade and used it for two summers before it needed replacing. I went with the square shape this time around for extra coverage but noticed that it is droopier or looser than the previous triangle shaped shade. Still offers good sun protection though.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Chen

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know what material it is, it’s more of a flat sewn nylon mesh than a regular sun shade mesh. Sort of like a red tarp vs. a screen material. I live in Arizona just outside of Phoenix and the sun here is relentless. I hope these could hold up. Otherwise the color and hardware is ok. More bright red vs. brick red...
customer_reviews.author: BCasale

customer_reviews.title: Nice Sunshade
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to close in our patio in Az for the summer when we are gone to block the suns rays from our golf car. We cover it but the sun is brutal in the Az summer so we hope this sail will hold up for the season. The material looks good and the light color will be helpful with the sun
customer_reviews.author: Lorne U

customer_reviews.title: Irregular fabric
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, the fabric was not as permeable as we would have liked. The fabric was also irregular in terms of finish. Had to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: P. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent sizing
customer_reviews.text: We ordered beige first which was really a pale yellow and allowed a lot if sun to come through, but rather than changing it we had a novel idea of doubling up with another color: brown. Sadly, the two are not the same dimensions and so the plan doesn't really work.
customer_reviews.author: Dan S

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Not water resistance which is good or else the water would pool and tear anything its mount on down. It still pools but eventually drains. Had one lasted a year, but I believe it was mainly my fault. I tore it with some 2x4s
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Timor

customer_reviews.title: so far so good !
customer_reviews.text: Please ignore the mess in the photo. :) we have quite an outside project happening ! :) We ordered a red, 8 x 8. The photo will give you a general idea of coverage. We can't speak to durability of the sun shade yet....but, so far so good ! The red color is bright and cheery.... just what we wanted ! Thank you !
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Extre,
customer_reviews.text: This is the best sail shade I’ve ever had. It is great material, great color and was the easiest I’ve ever had to install. I did buy a regular install kit because I wanted tension joints. It came with a nice install kit though. Highly recommend this product. It has already withstood some heavy winds.
customer_reviews.author: betty kiesle

customer_reviews.title: Good Alternative to Umbrellas
customer_reviews.text: Good alternative to Sun Umbrellas. Been up for a year thru storms without issue. Material is a tight mesh so rain comes thru. This is good so rain doesn't pool and weight down Screen. When wet, the screen droops a little but returns once dry. Will be purchasing again for other Projects
customer_reviews.author: Sundancer

customer_reviews.title: Just put it up
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for a sun shade that still let some light through and this has done that. I will come back to comment on durability as we just put it up a day ago. Feels like tough material, but we will see how it holds up on our windy porch.
customer_reviews.author: Kylie Haydock

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a while
customer_reviews.text: The fabric failed recently. I'm not sure how long it's supposed to work, but when I took it down after two years the fabric ripped.
customer_reviews.author: W. Booth

customer_reviews.title: it does a great job shading from the sun
customer_reviews.text: it does a great job shading from the sun, you feel cooler underneath it. However the fabric quality is not very good, and the seaming is not straight in all places. You get hwat you pay for, I assume a more expensive shade would have a better fabric quality. The included braided rope was nice.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: We've only had it installed for about a month. But seems to be holding upto the heat so far.
customer_reviews.author: Vince P.

customer_reviews.title: Not a true square.
customer_reviews.text: I was not impressed with this cover. It is not cut to a true 8x8 size the sides are curved, so its not a true square. I was not very happy when I went to put it on and it did not fit.
customer_reviews.author: Sunflower

customer_reviews.title: Its nice, we really like the shade over our deck ...
customer_reviews.text: Its nice, we really like the shade over our deck in the summer. Makes it easier for the kids to play out back without worrying about too much heat or putting on a ton of sunblock. The shade had a couple of questionable looking seams, but so far its holding up fine.
customer_reviews.author: spoon059

customer_reviews.title: Stetches out, bad!
customer_reviews.text: This Shade is nice and well made but the first moderate to heavy wind or rain will stretch this shade out I'm talking droopy sad looking stretched out. We have had to reposition the corners many Times. It was great until then I even purchased a smaller one for my kids sand box but I won't buy this brand again. My best advice is to get one at least a foot smaller on each side then what you actually need.
customer_reviews.author: matthew h.

customer_reviews.title: Works well, nice color selection
customer_reviews.text: Very durable, breaths but cuts sunlight well. I hang mine up under the awning with ball bungies all summer through sun and storm. Buy a new one every few years, just for a fun change of color, as they still work, a bit faded.
customer_reviews.author: eartheditor

customer_reviews.title: Product Specs are deceptive
customer_reviews.text: The description for this item is deceptive!! We ordered a 10’ x 10’ square shade, but found it only measured 9’ x 9’ and will not cover the area we purchased it for. It wasn’t hard to install, but we feel cheated by deceptive product specs published by the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel B

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Third sail I have put on my patio. Same brand. Work well and last. Color fades a little over years. I got blue and it made my grey house change to a blue grey tint when sunny
customer_reviews.author: Thela Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Second one we bought
customer_reviews.text: Got this to put over out hot tub so we don't have to sit in the sun. It is made of a strong material and won't fade. Strong stitching and sturdy metal rings at each corner for fastening
customer_reviews.author: karrieal

customer_reviews.title: Not water resistant but great shade.
customer_reviews.text: The reason I put a 3 star for water resistance is becouse when it rains s water goes right thru it. But other than that is a great product.i wanted somthig I could take down and put back up and this is great for that and its light weight and makes a great shade.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Reeves

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product & company.
customer_reviews.text: The 10×15 sail was exactly what we wanted. We ordered 3 & they look amazing on our house. They came within a week of ordering. Theres no real instructions, but I had been researching shade sails & with YouTube it was fairly easy for us. One of them did come with a manufacturer flaw & patio paradise was quick to replace it. I would reccomend this company not only for their product, but for their customer service.
customer_reviews.author: C baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Great shade
customer_reviews.text: Heavy material with nice stretch. Blocks direct sunlight and gives a great shaded area. The only issue I have is that the 4 retaining clips should be made to fit through the corner D-rings so I didnt have to use the rope.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Great product to give you some shade.
customer_reviews.text: I built a pergola and found this to attach inside of it. The perfect size and give you great shade. This should last 6 - 8 years easily but remember not to leave it out all year long. I’m in the Chicago area so I take it down for the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Cheap way to provide shade
customer_reviews.text: This worked so well for our small deck. Instead of building a wooden topper for the deck, we attached this to the house and metal poles on edge of the deck. Stretching it tightly and enjoying the shade it provided. Rain does make the center of Canopy droop, but it will go back to original shape when dry.
customer_reviews.author: Garden lady

customer_reviews.title: Not withstanding the rain or exterior use.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this screen for about 3 months now and the buckles are already rusted. This is not good. I would like to have this replaced. Is it possible? Thks.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Carlos Abril

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and functions ever better!
customer_reviews.text: This is well worth the money! We've had ours set up for the entire summer and it does an excellent job of providing shade! This is an excellent, cost effective way to add a little extra to your deck or patio. Love it and highly recommend it! We always get complements on how it looks as well. For a tip, don't buy the hardware and hanging equipment online, HD and Lowes have hooks and rope that you can use at a fraction of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: nope don't buy and or insure!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and after the first rain it ripped down! I have been trying to get it replaced as I bought the protection for it and four months later I still have yet to be able to get anywhere with asurion! not worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Gtc745

customer_reviews.title: ... the other side of the porch and am very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: We had this item on the other side of the porch and am very happy with it. It lets water through so you do not have a sagging tarp. We have had the other one for over a year now and it has held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Tippitt

customer_reviews.title: Hard to get a true beige color
customer_reviews.text: ordered two of these from different companies and they are either yellowish rather than the true beige or sand advertised. The pictures are not helpful. Need to return in ysed.
customer_reviews.author: Faye

customer_reviews.title: 👍🏻
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, got it for a great price. Easy to hang (when you purchase additional clasps, which we picked up at a local hardware store) and provides a solid amount of shade in our back yard. It looks amazing too. Instant way to “class up” the back yard space with shade.
customer_reviews.author: Jmchw

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sun shade
customer_reviews.text: Love this shade especially for the price! I also have Coolaroo in a different spot and this one seems to be the same type of material for half the price!
customer_reviews.author: JOSH J

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! My husband got it for me for Christmas because of patio is in full sun ALL day! I forget to take it down during an ice storm and it made it through it! I blocks just enough sun so I can go outside now. It does let rain through as it says but it all falls to the middle and drips down there. I HIGHLY recommend this for a cheap and pretty option to add some shade to your yard.
customer_reviews.author: Younique by Crissy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and color
customer_reviews.text: The quality is nice. The sail fabric was as expected and a nice color. I ordered three and all three were very similar in size (this was a problem with another brand...). I used them as vertical privacy screens in my backyard instead of as typical shade sails and they worked great for this. Easy to hang, sturdy, and held up to wind and rain fairly well. I was more concerned about my posts breaking during wind storms than the sails ripping.
customer_reviews.author: Georgeanne L. Oakes

customer_reviews.title: Not made to last
customer_reviews.text: This shade is only up a few months out of the year and otherwise kept in storage. This was only the 3rd summer we hung it up.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick N. Roberson

customer_reviews.title: Good shade and easy install
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. It shades my kid’s sand box very well. It was easy to install too.
customer_reviews.author: Serendipity.

customer_reviews.title: Good Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: After researching, we decided to go with Patio Paradise and ordered the sunshade. Upon arrive, we found that we could not put the product up the structural supports we wanted and had to return the item. Super easy to send back, no problems with the refund.
customer_reviews.author: marek white

customer_reviews.title: (20x16) Well made Sun screen!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! We got the red 16x20. Well made, but wish it had more than 4 grommets (only one on each corner). The weight of one so large makes it sag and it must retighten. Probably won't be a problem on smaller one after the initial stretching.
customer_reviews.author: steve williamsTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Good sun sail.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good sun sail. They do not protect against water but I am ok with that as I needed for protection from the sun for my plants. Easy to hang. Good quality. Price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy lee kalous

customer_reviews.title: It’s a Big One
customer_reviews.text: Great shade cover. This is a large one so be sure to use heavy duty poles and anchors. This is a beautiful tan/brown that blends nicely with my home.
customer_reviews.author: broywillia87

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Material is great, we used it as a drape over a pergola
customer_reviews.author: Hokey Schmokes

customer_reviews.title: Great shade!
customer_reviews.text: We are happy with this sunshade. It does not keep water out. I would rec’d at least a 1 ft drop from one side to the other so water doesn’t pool. Material stretches, expect to re tighten after a few days
customer_reviews.author: PeachyMom

customer_reviews.title: Take extra time and decide which size and shape you want
customer_reviews.text: I put this up over my spa. Gives shade if I don’t want the sun or I can move and be in the sun. Works exactly like I wanted it to. Attached it with bungee cords
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Very strong for storms
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good for shade which is what it was bought for and I just leave up during storms no tears and it is pretty stron
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Performed as desired.
customer_reviews.text: This shade sail has performed well! Placed over our above ground pool, the temperature of the pool dropped noticeably (which was the goal). The sail has survived a few of our famous East Texas thunder storms. Of course you get what you pay for, so I'm not sure how many summers it will last. The supplied rope is four 4ft lengths of somewhat useless white poly. I used heavy duty paracord to hang it, but that has stretched some.
customer_reviews.author: DrSmittyXJ

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Nice, fabric and color. Shields the sun perfectly. Looks and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Liam & Susan

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I think I would give this zero stars if I could . Had up for 2 days and already wearing down with a few holes . Disappointed .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: Over all I like it came on time. Looks good. But less then a month of being up I find this today. Update, ripped the rest of the way out.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Roy

customer_reviews.title: Much better Quality than the local available sunshade
customer_reviews.text: I live in the desert and they have sunshades like this here. This is the highest quality one I've seen. Webbing all around the edges, sturdy material, and the color is spot on. Great product and fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE my sunshade! Saved my poor horse from sweating to death in this summer heat. By the time is 10 AM she has no shade. So I bought this and attached it to her shelter, as you can see she’s very much enjoying it!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

product_meta.title: Patio Paradise 12' x 16' Brown Sun Shade Sail Rectangle Canopy - Permeable UV Block Fabric Durable Outdoor - Customized Available
product_meta.description:
Size Name:12'x16'| Color Name:Brown

Patio Paradise Sun Shade Sail - Advanced Sun Shade Canopy


Patio Paradise sun shade sail could bring your outdoor spaces a totally different experience during the warm months of the year. Rather than hiding away during the best parts of the day, with our sail shade you can spend time out of doors enjoying the fine weather. The shade shelter provides 88% up to 95% UV block while allowing cooling air circulation. Heat and glare are significantly reduced so the shade sails can make you comfortable even in the hottest days.


Patio Paradise Shade Sails are Versatile


*Can be used to your patio, swimming pool area, gardens, children's play areas, car spaces, or any other outdoor area
*Can easily shield your deck or patio from view and give you privacy from above
*Multiple colors and sizes for endless installation ideas to make your backyard unique and shady


Want customized size ? Call patio paradise now!


Call us on 626-715-4869 now to place order for a customize size as you like! The customize order will take 3-5 day longer to ship out, please note that our custom sun shade sails are made case-by-case and cannot be resold so please pick your size carefully.


Patio Paradise Only for Quality Sun Sails


*Constructed of HDPE material with UV-stabilized fabric for greater durability and protection
*Finished with strong stitched seam and durable stainless steel eyelets on each corner
*Breathable material design, allows cooling breezes and light to pass through for better airy and comfortable space
*3-year warranty,satisfaction guaranteed


Feel free to call us on 626-715-4869 or email on cservice@patio-paradise.com if you have any questions.
feature_bullets: Important: Our shade sails have curved sides to enhance pull strength and prevent drooping; this can add 1”-8” in side length. Middle-center of sail will be shorter in width due to curves. If straight sides are preferred please contact us. Read description for details

Ideal Shade Solutions - for your deck in backyard, pool and pond, pergola, sandbox, driveway or other outdoor area to protect against up to 95% harmful UV rays, and make your patio privacy safe, cool and fabulous

Includes one piece 12'x20' (3.7Mx4.9M) AREA FIT brown rectangle sun shade sail with curved sides, a 20 Feet PE rope, and an instruction sheet. The fabric is made by brown fabric with white stripes to give it a AREA FIT brown appearance (not solid).

Made of 100% brand new high-density Permeable UV Block Fabric 180GSM polyethylene knitted fabric material. Made so that no water is accumulated on top during rainfall, 0% recycled material,3 years warranty under normal usage and normal weather conditions.
Easy to Installation and Maintenance - with provided detailed instruction. Easy to clean with mild detergent and water, fade resistant, will not mold, mildew, stain, or tear.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars63 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
